subject: Psychology
title: Artificial Intelligence and Psychology
description: A 60-second lesson on Artificial Intelligence and Psychology.

hook.text: Alan Turing asked: can a machine think? Cognitive psychologists asked: does the mind work like a machine?

buildup.text: AI and cognitive psychology grew up together, each informing the other about how information processing works.

discovery.text: Early AI programs modeled human problem-solving. GPS (General Problem Solver) mimicked how people approach puzzles.

twist.text: Modern AI (deep learning) doesn't mimic human cognition at all â€” yet it outperforms humans on many tasks.

climax.text: AI challenges psychology: if a machine can think differently and still succeed, what is uniquely human about thought?

punchline.text: Machines think differently. That teaches us what human thinking really is.

quiz.question: How did AI and cognitive psychology influence each other?
options: Both explored how information processing works
AI had no relationship to psychology
